Apply this rule to all SIMs or only to the selected SIM.

No need to change this if you only use one SIM card or don\'t need to distinguish between multiple SIMs.

Requires Android 12+.

No need to change this if you only use one SIM card or don\'t need to distinguish between multiple SIMs.

When set as \"Any\", all rules will be checked, all per-rule SIM settings will be ignored.
When a SIM is selected, the call/SMS will be simulated on the selected SIM.

Requires Android 12+.
The %s permission is required but not granted.

Also known as Unknown Number or Empty Number, they are empty strings that can be matched by either of:
  .{0}
  ^$
  a blank regex field.

The priority is set to 20 to override other features like Repeated Call, so they are always blocked even if they repeat.

Block all international calls except those from your own country with regex \\+(?!39).*, calls pass this rule will not be immediately allowed, they will be checked by other rules.

Change 39 to your country code.

Regex breakdown:
  - The Raw Number regex flag preserves the leading +, otherwise, it will be removed before checking.
  - \\+(?!39) matches any number starting with + that is not followed by 39 (foreign numbers).
Allow SMS containing \"verification code\" or \"validation code\".

Extract the digits after the word \"code\".

This regex doesn\'t need to be very strict since the message has already been filtered by the SMS rules.
